org.modelio.vbasic.files

Class Zipper

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.modelio.vbasic.files.Zipper

  • public class Zipper
extends Object
    Service class to compress one or more directories into one .zip file.

    One instance is configured to produce one unique zip archive. The zip archive is build by calling one of the compress methods. Each time a compress method is called the complete archive contents are replaced.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Zipper

        public Zipper(Path archive)
        Construct a Zipper instance.

        Note that the instance is configured to produce one unique zip archive. The zip archive is build by calling one of the compress methods. Each time a compress method is called the complete archive contents are replaced.

        Parameters:
        archive - the full pathname of the archive to be produced by this zipper.

    • Method Detail

      • compressContent

        public void compressContent(Path path,
                            IModelioProgress monitor,
                            String title)
                     throws IOException
        Compress the directory content or file given by 'path'.
        Parameters:
        path - the pathname of the directory or file to compress
        monitor - an IModelioProgress object to report compression progression. Can be null.
        title - the title displayed for the compression task. Requires a 'monitor' instance. Can be null.
        Throws:
        IOException

      • compressContent

        public void compressContent(Iterable<Path> pathes,
                            IModelioProgress progressMonitor,
                            String title)
                     throws IOException
        Compress the contents of the directories list 'pathes'
        Parameters:
        monitor - an IModelioProgress object to report compression progression. Can be null.
        pathes - a list of directories or files (full pathes)
        title - the title displayed for the compression task. Requires a 'monitor' instance. Can be null.
        Throws:
        IOException
